item.title: ARM Your Golang Containers
item.description: So then, here is the deal. I write tiny microservices that may or may not serve any purpose. Despite how meaningless they might be, I give them the perfect operations treatment. Here is an example of such a service: hash-svc. At it’s core, all it does is take a string and returns it hash. tchaudhr:cmd/ (master✗) $ ./hash-svc -serverAddr :12000 {"addr":":12000","msg":"Started HTTP Server"} {"err":null,"input":"123","method":"hashsha256","output":"a665a45920422f9d417e4867efdc4fb8a04a1f3fff1fa07e998e86f7f7a27ae3","took":"41.472µs"} tchaudhr:~/ $ curl http://localhost:12000/hash\?s\=123 {"v":"a665a45920422f9d417e4867efdc4fb8a04a1f3fff1fa07e998e86f7f7a27ae3"} Now, to please my heart, I put this in a container, added a Makefile, hooked up my CI and started pushing out containers with every commit.
